verse_text: Now it happened that, when the Lord willed to lift up Elijah into heaven by a whirlwind, Elijah and Elisha were going out of Gilgal

And Elijah said to Elisha: â€œRemain here. For the Lord has sent me as far as Bethel.â€ And Elisha said to him, â€œAs the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not forsake you.â€ And when they had descended to Bethel

the sons of the prophets, who were at Bethel, went out to Elisha. And they said to him, â€œDo you not know that today the Lord will take away your lord from you?â€ And he responded: â€œI know it. Be silent.

Then Elijah said to Elisha: â€œRemain here. For the Lord has sent me to Jericho.â€ And he said, â€œAs the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not forsake you.â€ And when they had arrived at Jericho

the sons of the prophets, who were at Jericho, drew near to Elisha. And they said to him, â€œDo you not know that today the Lord will take away your lord from you?â€ And he said: â€œI know it. Be silent.

Then Elijah said to him: â€œRemain here. For the Lord has sent me as far as the Jordan.â€ And he said, â€œAs the Lord lives, and as your soul lives, I will not forsake you.â€ And so, the two of them continued on together
And fifty men from the sons of the prophets followed them, and they stood opposite them, at a distance. But the two of them were standing above the Jordan
And Elijah took his cloak, and he rolled it up, and he struck the waters, which were divided into two parts. And they both went across on dry ground

And when they had gone across, Elijah said to Elisha, â€œAsk what you wish that I may do for you, before I am taken from you.â€ And Elisha said, â€œI beg you, that twice your spirit may be accomplished in me.
And he responded: â€œYou have requested a difficult thing. Nevertheless, if you see me when I am taken from you, you will have what you requested. But if you do not see, it shall not be.
And as they continued on, they were conversing while walking. And behold, a fiery chariot with fiery horses divided the two. And Elijah ascended by a whirlwind into heaven
Then Elisha saw it, and he cried out: â€œMy father, my father! The chariot of Israel with its driver!â€ And he saw him no more. And he took hold of his own garments, and he tore them into two parts
And he picked up the cloak of Elijah, which had fallen from him. And turning back, he stood above the bank of the Jordan

And he struck the waters with the cloak of Elijah, which had fallen from him, and they were not divided. And he said, â€œWhere is the God of Elijah, even now?â€ And he struck the waters, and they were divided here and there. And Elisha went across

Then the sons of the prophets, who were at Jericho, watching from a distance, said, â€œThe spirit of Elijah has rested upon Elisha.â€ And approaching to meet him, they reverenced him prone on the ground

And they said to him, â€œBehold, with your servants there are fifty strong men, who are able to go forth and to seek your lord. For perhaps, the Spirit of the Lord has taken him up and cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley.â€ But he said, â€œDo not send them.
And they urged him, until he acquiesced and said, â€œSend them.â€ And they sent fifty men. And after they had searched for three days, they did not find him
And they returned to him, for he was living in Jericho. And he said to them: â€œDid I not say to you, â€˜Do not send them?â€™
Also, the men of the city said to Elisha: â€œBehold, this city is a very good habitation, as you yourself perceive, O lord. But the waters are very bad, and the ground is barren.
And so he said, â€œBring a new vessel to me, and place salt in it.â€ And when they had brought it
he went out to the source of the waters, and he cast the salt into it. And he said: â€œThus says the Lord: I have healed these waters, and no longer shall there be death or barrenness in them.
Then the waters were healed, even to this day, in accord with the word of Elisha, which he spoke
Then he went up from there into Bethel. And as he was ascending along the way, little boys departed from the city. And they were mocking him, saying: â€œGo up, bald head! Go up, bald head!
And when he had looked back, he saw them, and he cursed them in the name of the Lord. And two bears went out from the forest, and they wounded forty-two boys among them
Then he went away from there to mount Carmel. And he returned from there into Samaria
